The previous era ended and the new one commenced in Tenchō 10, on the 3rd day of the 1st month of 834.Brown, p. 284. ==Events of the Jōwa era== * 834 (Jōwa 1): Emperor Ninmyō planted a cherry tree near the shishinden to replace the tree Emperor Kanmu had planted at the time the capital was established in Kyoto.Ponsonby-Fane, Richard A.B. (1956). Kyoto: the Old Capital of Japan, p. 63. * 834 (Jōwa 1): Kūkai is given permission to establish a Shingon chapel at the Imperial Palace.Kukai. (1972). * June 11, 840 (Jōwa 7, 8th day of the 5th month): The former-Emperor Junna died at the age of 55. * 843 (Jōwa 10): Work was completed on the multi-volume Nihon Kōki.Nussbaum, "Nihon Kōki" in . By the Jōwa era, the formality of male promotions (Dansei jōi) were announced by the seventh day of each new year, while those for women (Onna jōi) were announced on the eighth day.Ko, Dorothy et al.
